gcci.text: At an average H100 price of $3.15/hr, supply tightness and limited capacity allocation are forcing buyers to pay premiums and front-load capex, delaying relief until new fab and substrate capacity ramps.

gtpi.text: With the average input price at $1.35/1M tokens, API providers are locked in price compression, shifting spend toward efficiency gains through smaller models, caching, and compression.

gagl.text: A 120 TWh annual load indicates grid strain in AI hubs, accelerating nuclear baseload and firm renewable procurement while pressuring the carbon footprint to stay within 2030 targets.

aipi.text: Industry sentiment remains buoyant as compute and token prices compress, but rising capex and energy intensity elevate bubble and sustainability risks without structural efficiency gains.
